page.title: 05'CAPABILITY'BROWN,FENSTANTON
page.content: { 'Capability'}was not his proper name it was{Lancelot.}It was his nickname because,he always said he was {capable of improving. He came to{Fenstanton Manor}in 1767.{The Lord of Northampton}owed him {Â£12000}so he gave him the Manor instead.In{1783 6th February}he died. He did not always live in Fenstanton because{he worked for the king.}His official residence was{Wilderness {House, Hampton Court,Middlesex. { }He became well know in the{1740's} as a landscape gardener.His plaque can be found in the Fenstanton Church.When he worked for the king he lived in{ {Mayfair}and when he was going home he collapsed in the street. His wife spent her last 4 years in {Kensington}and then she died and was {buried in Fenstanton with her husband. { }
